body:
Are you talking about client (i.e. a ftp backend), or server (i.e. the serve command)?

I think strictly speaking there is no concept of anonymous mode in ftp, but there is a de-facto standard to allow login of an account with name "anonymous" and typically same password. Do you agree? See e.g. https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1635.

> Are you talking about client (i.e. a ftp backend), or server (i.e. the serve command)?
> 
> I think strictly speaking there is no concept of ![Uploading image.pngâ€¦]() mode in ftp, but there is a de-facto standard to allow login of an account with name "anonymous" and typically same password. Do you agree? See e.g. https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1635.

I thought I may be talked about anonymous login. It is supported by Explorer on Windows. With the username of "Anonymous" and no password

Do you mean running `rclone serve ftp`, and then be able to access it anonymously, for example from Windows Explorer?
Or do you mean running `rclone copy remote:\Temp C:\Temp` and similar, where you have configured `remote:` as a remote of type ftp, to access a external ftp server anonymously?

I want to use rclone to connect to the FTP server anonymously. However, rclone must type/generate a password when adding a remote service of FTP. It seems that rclone doesn't support connecting to FTP anonymously now.

I think I mean the second one. I want to use `rclone mount remote:/ X:`

```
FTP password
y) Yes type in my own password
g) Generate random password
y/g>
```

Thanks. Now; in that case I would expect you could enter `anonymous` as username, or possibly `ftp`. And then the same as password, or possibly empty string, or (something that looks like) an email address. Can you try if any of those combinations work?
This probably needs a mention in the backend docs.

Agreed. Though, I'm not sure how standardized the username/password combo is? Seems `anonymous` as username is quite standard, but not password. Do @ivandeex have more insight on this?

Rclone's serve ftp, by the way, defaults to anonymous access: Clients must supply username `anonymous`, but it accepts *any* password. If accessing it from a rclone ftp remote you have to set a password (required option), and you have to go through the obscure, it seems. So a bit awkward, at least for ad-hoc access, e.g. connection string syntax.

> Thanks. Now; in that case I would expect you could enter `anonymous` as username, or possibly `ftp`. And then the same as password, or possibly empty string, or (something that looks like) an email address. Can you try if any of those combinations work?

I test it locally by randomly generating a password and it works fine. I'll try it later on 10.8 after the vacation is over.

> Seems `anonymous` as username is quite standard, but not password.

Password can be _any_.

> So a bit awkward, at least for ad-hoc access, e.g. connection string syntax.

Just a bit. We could provide in the docs an example of connection string with a random short word obscured, like `:ftp,host=localhost,user=anonymous,pass=pVuLAfCeU9n7abDpktw3rU7T` (I obscured `hi`).

On a closer look, backend docs already mentions anonymous two places already:

> For an anonymous FTP server, use anonymous as username and your email address as password.

> rclone lsf :ftp: --ftp-host=speedtest.tele2.net --ftp-user=anonymous --ftp-pass=\`rclone obscure dummy\`

The second is just shown as an example of usage without config file, not explicitely mentioning anonymous access, and it will not work for Windows users. Something like this would be a variant for Windows/PowerShell:
```
rclone lsf :ftp: --ftp-host=speedtest.tele2.net --ftp-user=anonymous --ftp-pass=$(rclone obscure dummy)
```

An example with a "pre-obscured" password like you suggested would also be convenient.

So, to conclude: Anonymous access is supported, and documented. Although docs on it could be made more clear.
Let's find time sometime later to ~~correct~~ enhance the docs.

rename.to: ftp/docs: improve description of anonymous ftp

issue.title: Improve documentation of Anonymous FTP

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files
